docs.lead_paragraph: The heads of Wall Street's biggest firms descended upon the New York Federal Reserve on Saturday to figure out how to shore up the American financial system.

headline.main: The Wall Street Rescue Effort, in Pictures

docs.abstract: The chief of nearly every major Wall Street firm gathered at the New York Federal Reserve in downtown Manhattan on Saturday, as the government sought to corral the industry into solving the problems posed by a faltering Lehman Brothers. DealBook has pictures from the scene.

docs.lead_paragraph: As Wall Street scoured the financial industry Wednesday for the next weakest link after Lehman Brothers, it set its sights on a familiar target: Washington Mutual, the nation's largest savings and loan.

headline.main: Is Washington Mutual Running Out of Time?

docs.abstract: As Wall Street scoured the financial industry Wednesday for the next weakest link after Lehman Brothers, it set its sights on a familiar target: Washington Mutual, the nation's largest savings and loan. Shares in the troubled lender, one of those hardest hit by the nation's housing crisis, plunged 30 percent, falling below $3 for the [...]

byline.original: By ERIC DASH and GERALDINE FABRIKANT

docs.lead_paragraph: ALBANY -- Citizen Action of New York, the advocacy group, released a new report on Wednesday that says State Senate Republicans take far more of the health insurance industry's money than Assembly Democrats do."As a result of the cozy relationship of the Senate Republicans to corporate dollars, consumers are paying a high price," said Jessica Wisneski, campaign director of Citizen Action, in a statement accompanying the report, which is entitled "The High Cost of 'Pay to Play.'"
docs.abstract: News of an indictment of a Democrat overshadowed a report on the relationship between Albany Republicans and the health insurance industry.
docs.snippet: News of an indictment of a Democrat overshadowed a report on the relationship between Albany Republicans and the health insurance industry.

headline.main: Governor Palin and the Pro-Family Agenda

docs.abstract: Don't let the evil media tell you otherwise: the country's new No. 1 mom is Sarah Palin of Alaska - hockey mom, Wal-Mart mom, governor mom, running-for-vice-president mom.
